Steps.Description: The attacker identifies vulnerabilities in the target system, including improper input validation and insecure configuration.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes they can bypass the WAF protection and access local resources.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker attempts to exploit the improper input validation vulnerability by crafting a malicious input.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully bypasses the WAF protection and gains access to the 'admin-status' page.

Steps.Description: The attacker leverages the insecure configuration of the target system to further exploit the vulnerability.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that using octal IP notation will allow them to bypass IP address filtering.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker crafts a malicious URL with an octal IP address (http://0177.0.0.1/admin-status).
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully bypasses the IP address filtering and gains access to the 'admin-status' page.

Steps.Description: The attacker retrieves the flag from the 'admin-status' page.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that the flag is stored on the 'admin-status' page.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker retrieves the flag from the 'admin-status' page.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully obtains the flag: TWCTF{4r3y0ur34dy?n3x75746315r34l55rf!}
